svcproc.title: WHEEL SENSOR
svcproc.para: The wheel speed sensors are mounted on the axle ends ( Figure 2). The wheel sensors house a permanent magnet, which creates a magnetic field. When the field created by the sensor magnet is interrupted by the teeth of the exciter ring moving through it, an A.C. voltage is produced. The frequency of the voltage increases or decreases as the wheel speed increases or decreases. The sensor has a pigtail with a two-pin connector that connects to the ABS harness mating connector. The sensor signal goes from the sensor, through the ABS harness to the controller, through either an 18-way connector (350) or 30-way connector (355), depending on the location of the wheel sensor. The left and right front wheel sensors connect to controller 30-way connector (355), and the rear wheel sensors connect to controller 18-way connector (350).
